plants.name: Prunus serrulata
plants.description: A deciduous tree famous for its stunning clusters of delicate pink or white flowers that herald the arrival of spring in temperate regions.
plants.funFact: The blossoming of cherry trees is celebrated in Japan with Hanami festivals, marking a symbol of renewal and fleeting beauty.

plants.name: Nerium oleander
plants.description: An evergreen shrub or small tree with clusters of fragrant, trumpet-shaped flowers commonly seen in Mediterranean climates.
plants.funFact: Oleander is highly toxic if ingested, yet it has been used traditionally for medicinal purposes with extreme caution.

plants.name: Lathyrus odoratus
plants.description: A climbing plant grown for its fragrant, butterfly-shaped flowers often used in gardens and floral arrangements.
plants.funFact: Sweet peas were first cultivated in the early 17th century and remain popular for their sweet scent and diverse colors.

plants.name: Banksia integrifolia
plants.description: A tree native to Australia with cylindrical flower spikes composed of hundreds of small individual flowers, often bright yellow or orange.
plants.funFact: Banksias provide vital nectar for a variety of native birds and mammals and are important for Australian ecosystems.
